info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:20PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Waynesburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesburg, Jefferson Boro, Fairdale, Carmichaels, Rices Landing, and Clarksville. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania.
